meanings.definition: A person or thing that intercepts.
meanings.sent1: The intercepter caught the ball before it hit the ground.
meanings.sent2: The intercepter intercepted the pass during the game.
meanings.sent3: The clever intercepter managed to grab the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent4: She was like an intercepter of secrets, always knowing what others were up to.
meanings.sent5: The intercepter's quick reflexes made them a valuable asset to the team.

meanings.definition: A military aircraft designed to intercept enemy aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The intercepter flew swiftly to intercept the enemy planes.
meanings.sent2: The air force deployed an intercepter to protect the airspace.
meanings.sent3: The intercepter pilot joked that they were playing a game of tag with the enemy planes.
meanings.sent4: The intercepter soared through the sky like a vigilant guardian.
meanings.sent5: The intercepter's radar detected the enemy aircraft approaching.

meanings.definition: A device used to intercept communications.
meanings.sent1: The intercepter decoded the encrypted messages sent by the spies.
meanings.sent2: Government agencies often use intercepters to monitor suspicious communications.
meanings.sent3: The intercepter beeped excitedly every time it intercepted a new message.
meanings.sent4: The intercepter was like a silent listener in the world of digital conversations.
meanings.sent5: The intercepter's advanced technology allowed it to intercept even the most secure transmissions.
